Class RecursiveTreePainting

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • RecursiveTreePainting
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class RecursiveTreePainting
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    This class is an interactive class that draws a flowered tree with a tree trunk as long as the users dragging movement and many branches. Code base borrowed from TreePainting Assignment 2
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Method for drawing on this component. Overrides the paint method specified in JComponent (parent) Paints the background in every click (and initially without user interaction) Draws the tree trunk and calculates the angle between the tree trunk and the p The point p is a set of coordinates of the end point of the tree trunk Also the magnitude is also calculated between the starting coordinates and the end coordinates of the users interaction The magnitude is the passed as parameters for branch length Then the branches are drawn and the boolean clicked is set to false to initiate the method again with another user interaction
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        Graphics - g

      • paintBranch

        public void paintBranch(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                        int generation,
                        double angle,
                        java.awt.geom.Point2D point,
                        double length)
        Method for drawing the tree branches attached to the top part of the tree trunk based on the points of the users pressing and releasing the mouse. We set the color, transparency and thickness of the pen and draw triples of branches because we have set the children to triples, the angle is changed by default by 120 degrees plus the number of the loop the branch is drawn on If it's the last generation of the branches then the paintFlower method is called and we add the flowers else the generation number is decreased by 1, the angle is decreased by 90 degrees and the length is the 3/4 of the previous length and the method is recalled.
        Parameters:
        Graphics - g
        int - generation
        double - angle
        Point2D - point
        double - length

      • paintFlowers

        public void paintFlowers(java.awt.Graphics2D flower,
                         java.awt.geom.Point2D coordinates,
                         double branchLength)
        Method for drawing the tree blossomed flowers attached to the top branches of the tree trunk represented by little circles. We generate randomized values up to 255 to set each of the three values of colors. Warm colors have a lot of red and not a lot of blue thus the values are adjusted. This method draws only one flower when called alone thus each flower will be of different color The parameter coordinates is the point that the flower is going to be drawn. Lastly, the diameter of the flower is modified as to fit the length of the branches the diameter is the set diameter number plus half the length of the branches divided by 10
        Parameters:
        Graphics2D - flower
        int - coordinates

      • paintTree

        public void paintTree(java.awt.Graphics tree,
                      int x1,
                      int y1,
                      int x2,
                      int y2)
        Method for painting the tree trunk on the screen by creating a filled thin line the assigned color based on the points of the users pressing and releasing the mouse. We set the color of the tree trunk to a preferred color, we transform the graphics to 2D to add the effect of the pen which are transparency and color Lastly we draw the tree trunk as a line.
        Parameters:
        Graphics - g
        int - startPointx
        int - startPointy
        int - endPointx
        int - endPointy

      • computeEndpoint

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D computeEndpoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D p,
                                             double length,
                                             double angle)
        Compute the point that is length away from point p at the specified angle. Uses cosine to get the new x coordinate, sine to get the new y coordinate. Given!
        Parameters:
        Point2D - p
        double - branchLength
        double - angle
